qas.question: After what age could women become members of the Dominican Order?
What type of veil must the sisters wear?
The formula for profession into the Dominican Order is presented in what text?
What were the nuns allowed to minimally do?
What were the nuns tested on?
What age could women become members of the Benedictine order?

plausible_answers.text: obedience to God, the Blessed Virgin, their prioress and her successors

qas.question: What did the Constitutions of Montargis not demand of the nuns?
What type of veil did the sisters not have to wear?

plausible_answers.text: white tunic and scapular, a leather belt, a black mantle, and a black veil

qas.question: What was not required of the sisters to wear?

plausible_answers.text: reveal whether they were actually married women who had merely separated from their husbands

qas.question: What were candidates to profession not tested to do?

context: Women could not be professed to the Dominican religious life before the age of <a0_0><b5_0>thirteen<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The formula for profession contained in <a2_0>the Constitutions of Montargis Priory<a2_0/> (1250) demands that nuns pledge <b6_0>obedience to God, the Blessed Virgin, their prioress and her successors<b6_0/> according to the Rule of St. Augustine and the institute of the order, until death. The clothing of the sisters consisted of a <b8_0>white tunic and scapular, a leather belt, a black mantle, and a <a1_0><b7_0>black<b7_0/><a1_0/> veil<b8_0/>. Candidates to profession were tested to <b9_0>reveal whether they were actually married women who had merely separated from their husbands<b9_0/>. Their <a4_0>intellectual abilities<a4_0/> were also tested. Nuns were to be silent in places of prayer, the cloister, the dormitory, and refectory. Silence was maintained unless the prioress granted an exception for a specific cause. <a3_0>Speak<a3_0/>ing was allowed in the common parlor, but it was subordinate to strict rules, and the prioress, subprioress or other senior nun had to be present.
